task_summary: The robot is tasked to pick up the red object from the table using sequential perception, approach, grasp planning and actuation steps.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robotic arm observing a workspace with several objects placed on a black table. The main target is the red object (a cylinder) positioned centrally among several blue objects. The robot must perceive, locate, and pick up the red object via a standard top grasp, using visual feedback and tactile contact. The gripper opens prior to grasping, lowered until gentle contact is made, and closes with moderate force, verifying stability before confirming success. The scene is static, with no dynamic obstacles.
preconditions: Red object is present on the table
stepwise_plan: Check if the red object is visible; scan if not
Detect and localize the red object
Move to a position above the red object
Compute grasp pose using top strategy
Approach and align within tight tolerance
Lower until contact threshold is reached
Verify grasp stability and object presence
success_criteria: Red object securely held in gripper
Grasp is stable and object presence confirmed
failure_and_recovery: Failure to perceive object: Retry visual scan up to 3 times
Grasp failure: abort and retry sequence from pre-grasp
Contact not detected: abort attempt and re-approach
task_long_description.termination: Successful grasp and confirmation create termination; abort if unrecoverable failure occurs.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is currently visible
Scans workspace for the red object in raster pattern
Detects and localizes the red object
Opens the gripper to the specified width
Moves arm to a position above the red object
Computes grasp pose using the top strategy
Approaches and aligns to the red object with tight tolerance
Lowers arm until contact is detected
Closes gripper with moderate force on the object
Checks if the grasp is stable
Verifies that the red object is inside the gripper

failure_modes: Red object is occluded or absent
recovery_strategy: Fallback to scan if visibility fails, retry up to 3 times
Abort and reset approach/grasp sequence if grasp fails
assumptions: Visual evidence matches the instruction: the red object is visible and centrally located in all frames
No significant occlusion or dynamic obstacles
All actions are available in the node library and map directly to the episode

expected_success_criteria: Red object is picked up and held securely
No damage to object or table
